subject: Sleep
title: Hustle Culture vs Sleep
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Hustle Culture vs Sleep.

hook.text: I'll sleep when I'm dead, said every hustle culture influencer. Science says that death might come sooner because of it.

buildup.text: Silicon Valley glorified sleep deprivation. Executives bragged about four-hour sleep nights as signs of dedication.

discovery.text: This attitude ignores decades of research showing that chronic short sleep increases mortality, disease, and errors.

twist.text: The tide is turning. Leaders like Jeff Bezos and Arianna Huffington now publicly prioritize eight hours of sleep.

climax.text: The cultural shift from sleep-shaming to sleep-celebrating is slow but measurably changing workplace policies.

punchline.text: Bragging about no sleep went from impressive to ignorant.

quiz.question: How is the cultural attitude toward sleep changing?
options: People are sleeping even less now
Leaders are increasingly promoting eight hours and sleep-positive policies
